answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Some of the common causes of foggy head are anemia, poor sleep pattern, sinusitis and hypoglycemia. All these can cause a sense of light headedness too.  Endocrine problems, such as an underactive thyroid (called hypothyroidism), overactive thyroid (called hyperthyroidism), adrenal insufficiency (called Addison's disease), and in some cases, diabetes, may lead to hypotension and hence lightheadedness and an off balance feeling.I think you should discuss these possibilities with your doctor. It is difficult to comment beyond this. A comprehensive investigation is required keeping all the points in mind.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!
